line_1: 'None pity me, and none relieve,
line_2: 'Till Fortune gave me a Reprieve:

line_1: And faithful to relieve.
line_2: Its just restraint to give,

line_1: Can woe unfeign'd incite heav'n to relieve
line_2: Oh! never, never will I cease to grieve!

line_1: And from the wounding Steel his Jaw relieve.
line_2: While You with Joy the grateful Prey receive,

line_1: Till wanton Boys the trembling Wretch relieve,
line_2: Free from Confinement, but of Life bereave.

line_1: But ill thy lasting pangs relieve.
line_2: Which to your votaries you give,

line_1: Come, and my anxious Heart relieve:
line_2: For in your Presence who could grieve?

line_1: O might I be enabled to relieve
line_2: The wants, and sooth the cares of those that grieve;

line_1: Who hears the Want she never can relieve!
line_2: O think, how must a wretched Mother grieve,

line_1: Relief to offer, if I can't relieve;
line_2: Yet still permit me in thy Griefs to grieve,

line_1: Whether thy bounty pining want relieve,
line_2: Or lenient pity sooth the hearts that grieve;

line_1: For Miseries I can't relieve.
line_2: And form'd, unhappily, to grieve

line_1: Or, healthful hunger to relieve,
line_2: Our stated wholesome meals receive, —

line_1: Prone the distressed to relieve,
line_2: And little trespasses forgive,

line_1: And smiles on Hunger which he'll ne'er relieve.
line_2: Who with a Nod can make the Wretch believe,

line_1: But, if the fates allow, unseen thy woes relieve.
line_2: But should her cruel wrath these hopes deceive,

line_1: But, if the fates allow, unseen thy woes relieve.
line_2: Yet shall thy lover ne'er his Psyche leave,

line_1: Now Flock, nor Stream, nor Winds can e'er relieve
line_2: A Wretch like me, for ever born to grieve.

line_1: For sounds, tho' sweet, can ne'er relieve
line_2: Cease, cease unhappy fair to grieve,

line_1: Sees meek humanity distress relieve;
line_2: Sees civil prowess mightier acts atchieve,

line_1: Thy pensive song would oft my cares relieve,
line_2: WHY from these shades, sweet bird of eve,
